ygData.subject: Explanations
ygData.msgSnippet: Teltoli looked down at the meat that Carnage had thrown before her, and grimaced. Yummy.. She thought sarcastically. Back on Cybertron they had those neat

Subject: Explanations
Message-ID: <932rgb+p71p@...>

Teltoli looked down at the meat that Carnage had thrown before her, 
and grimaced. 'Yummy..' She thought sarcastically. Back on Cybertron 
they had those neat little cube things they had just invented. Pity 
they didn't have any over here.

Especially the caramel flavoured ones...

With a sigh she took a step forwards, but her step was halted by the 
sentance Carnage had practically spat. Her eyes widened in shock. 
"No! Of course I wouldn't do that! I would never ever do such a 
thing.."

The prospect of even aiming a gun at her friend seemed like a sin to 
her! How Carnage could think about her doing such a thing was.. 
beyond her knowledge. But Teltoli knew anger had to be brewing inside 
her friend since she had left.. anger at her.

Teltoli stood up and trotted after Carnage as she began to walk away. 
She too could feel a storm brewing, and the directioon they were 
headed.. she wasn't sure about, but she trusted Carnage and decided 
to follow her.

"I didn't.. leave.. because of nothing you know. My Father and my 
General called me back to Cybertron. I got a promotion, and if I 
didn't leave promptly, the promotion would have been cancelled.." She 
said quietly, but she knew it was loud enough for Carnage's ears.

But anyone could have felt the unspoken question between them. 'Why 
didn't you tell anyone?' Teltoli mentally asked herself, imagining it 
was someone else asking her. She braced herself.

"I didn't tell anyone because it's a highly classified mission that I 
was put in charge of. It appears Cybertron made some new enemies, and 
we were sent to infiltrate their planet. I was in charge, and since I 
apparantly did a good job, I got promoted.." She explained, hoping 
Carnage would understand.

"I'm sorry for not telling you, I truely am, if I could take back my 
actions I would, but it had to be done. And no, I don't obey my 
Superiors to the point of shooting my friends" Her lips quirked in a 
smile, but she fought it down and waited.
